intro: Acalypha haplostyla var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and unique inflorescence. The plant features palmate leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in suitable climates.

It is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in lowland areas with moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other tropical regions around the world.
